tag_narrative: By 2030, double the global rate of improvement in energy efficiency
title_narrative: Support to UNDP-China for facilitating South-South Cooperation on renewable energy technology transfer from China to Ghana and Zambia
description_narrative: The overall development objective is enhanced capacity for South-South development cooperation between China and countries in Africa (i.a. Ghana and Zambia) within renewable energy technology transfer to be developed and tested. The specific objective for the Ghana component is to contribute to climate change mitigation and reduced poverty by increasing access to renewable energy solutions through enhanced investment and production of renewable energy technologies in Ghana within the framework of South-South cooperation between Ghana and China. The specific objective for the Zambia component is to improve energy access and living conditions in rural Zambia through South-South cooperation by promoting electrification of rural communities in Zambia and to strengthen China's capacity for South-South cooperation.
result_title_narrative: 1.1 Strategy and policies for enhanced use, regulation and promotion of renewable energy technology in Ghana in place

result_indicator_title_narrative: 1.1 Strategy and policies for enhanced use, regulation and promotion of renewable energy technology in Ghana in place
result_indicator_period_actual_value: 1) Expert. Dr. Essel Ben Hagan. was engaged to conduct the review of Chinese and Ghanaian RE policies and strategies. To support the work. PMU facilitated 4 focus group discussions for CSOs. research institutions. public sector. development partners and financial institutions in June 2015. 2) A Chinese expert participated in a 2-day workshop to review RE policies. strategies and laws and compare these with Chinese experience to establish common areas of learning. The workshops incl. 50 participants from government agencies. private sector and research organisations. A workshop was held to validate findings and conclusions. 3)-4) Dr. Hagan collaborated with a Chinese expert engaged by ACCA21. Dr. Shen. Dr. Shen provided further insights on Chinese policies. strategies and plans on the RE-sector. The initial findings from this work were presented in the workshop held in July and Sept. 2015 for feedback and general comments.
result_indicator_period_target_value: 1) Conduct workshops in Ghana for stakeholders on China and Ghanaâ€™s renewable energy policy. 2) Joint review of renewable energy policies in Ghana. 3) Conduct gaps analysis through stakeholder consultations and seminars. 4) Organise workshop/seminars to identify solutions to address the identified gaps.
